com.stormpath.spring.config

Class ClientApiKeyFactoryBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.AbstractFactoryBean<ApiKey>
      • com.stormpath.spring.config.ClientApiKeyFactoryBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanClassLoaderAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanFactoryAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean, org.springframework.beans.factory.FactoryBean<ApiKey>, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    public class ClientApiKeyFactoryBean
extends org.springframework.beans.factory.config.AbstractFactoryBean<ApiKey>
    A Spring FactoryBean that produces a singleton ApiKey that will be used to authentication communication requests sent by a Client to the Stormpath REST API. This is primarily for Spring XML configuration. If using Spring Java Config, consider using ApiKeys.builder() instead.

    The resulting ApiKey instance is expected to be used when constructing the Client instance. For example, in conjunction with the ClientFactoryBean.

    Since:
    1.0.RC4
    See Also:
    ClientFactoryBean

    • Method Detail

      • setId

        public void setId(String id)
        Sets the apiKey ID that will be used when authenticating the client requests to the Stormpath REST API. If unspecified, property value lookup heuristics will be used to find the apiKeyId value.
        Parameters:
        id - the apiKey ID that will be used when authenticating the client requests to the Stormpath REST API.

      • setSecret

        public void setSecret(String secret)
        Sets the ApiKey secret that will be used when authenticating client requests to the Stormpath REST API. If unspecified, property value lookup heuristics will be used to find the apiKeyId value.

        For security reasons, it is strongly recommended that you do not configure raw secret values in Spring configuration that can be seen by other developers and checked in to version control. Spring property placeholders and/or environment variables are recommended instead.

        Parameters:
        secret - the ApiKey secret that will be used when authenticating client requests to the Stormpath REST API.

      • setFile

        public void setFile(org.springframework.core.io.Resource file)
        Sets the apiKey.properties file that will be used to look up the ApiKey id and secret. fileIdPropertyName is the name of the property used to acquire the id value and defaults to apiKey.id. fileSecretPropertyName is the name of the property used to acquire the secret value and defaults to apiKey.secret.
        Parameters:
        file - the apiKey.properties file that will be used to look up the ApiKey id and secret.

      • setFileIdPropertyName

        public void setFileIdPropertyName(String fileIdPropertyName)
        Sets the name of the property in any properties file discovered that represents the ApiKey ID value, defaults to apiKey.id.
        Parameters:
        fileIdPropertyName - the name of the property in any properties file discovered that represents the ApiKey ID value, defaults to apiKey.id.

      • setFileSecretPropertyName

        public void setFileSecretPropertyName(String fileSecretPropertyName)
        Sets the name of the property in any properties file discovered that represents the ApiKey secret value, defaults to apiKey.secret.
        Parameters:
        fileSecretPropertyName - the name of the property in any properties file discovered that represents the ApiKey secret value, defaults to apiKey.secret.
